question.title: Got build failed after adding PreferenceFragmentCompat library
question.body:
I'm working on an Android app and I recently added the following dependency to my build.gradle:

implementation 'androidx.preference:preference-ktx:1.2.1'

After syncing the project and trying to build it, I get the following error:

    Execution failed for task ':app:mergeDebugResources'.
> A failure occurred while executing com.android.build.gradle.internal.res.ResourceCompilerRunnable
   > Resource compilation failed (Failed to compile values resource file D:\AndroidStudioProjects\NETIClient\app\build\intermediates\incremental\debug\mergeDebugResources\merged.dir\values\values.xml. Cause: java.nio.file.InvalidPathException: Illegal char <:> at index 51: com.dertefter.neticlient.app-mergeDebugResources-66:/values/values.xml). Check logs for more details.

* Try:
> Run with --info or --debug option to get more log output.
> Run with --scan to get full insights.
> Get more help at https://help.gradle.org.

* Exception is:
org.gradle.api.tasks.TaskExecutionException: Execution failed for task ':app:mergeDebugResources'.

dependencies {

    implementation 'androidx.preference:preference-ktx:1.2.1'

    testImplementation 'junit:junit:4.13.2'
    androidTestImplementation 'androidx.test.ext:junit:1.2.1'
    androidTestImplementation 'androidx.test.espresso:espresso-core:3.6.1'
}

kapt {
    correctErrorTypes true
}

Iâ€™ve already tried:

  • Cleaning and rebuilding the project
  • Invalidate Caches & Restart in Android Studio
  • Deleting .gradle, build, and .idea folders
  • Downgrading to androidx.preference:preference-ktx:1.1.1 (same error)

Removing this library from project fixes errors, but I want to use it

answers.body:
Remove incompatible support library

  • Remove this line from

build.gradle:

implementation 'com.android.support:cardview-v7:28.0.0'

  • Replace it with:

implementation 'androidx.cardview:cardview:1.0.0'

This mix of AndroidX and legacy com.android.support is a known cause of resource merge failures.

  • Clean and rebuild

After you make the changes:

  • Delete these folders manually:

D:\AndroidStudioProjects\NETIClient\.gradle D:\AndroidStudioProjects\NETIClient\app\build

  • In terminal (from project root):

./gradlew clean

./gradlew build

and try once

question_comments.body: The logs indicates the issues lies in the resource file either the name or the contents (most likely) in it with a illegal char. Check the res folder of your app

This file (D:\AndroidStudioProjects\NETIClient\application\build\inter‌​mediates\incremental‌​\debug\mergeDebugRes‌​ources\merged.dir\va‌​lues\values\values.x‌​ml) is huge with 17000 lines.  I have checked this file and found nothing unusual in it.   Also I am updated my question and added info about dependencies.

Have you checked the following file? D:\AndroidStudioProjects\NETIClient\app\build\intermediates\‌​incremental\debug\me‌​rgeDebugResources\me‌​rged.dir\values\valu‌​es.xml. Cause: java.nio.file.InvalidPathException: Illegal char <:> at index 51: com.dertefter.neticlient.app-mergeDebugResources-66:/values/‌​values.xml) Also, what are your other dependencies?
